articles.title: German Christmas market evacuated after improvised nail bomb is found
articles.description: A Christmas market in the German city of Potsdam has been evacuated after a suspected nail bomb was found nearby - but police have now defused it. It was reportedly delivered to a pharmacy.

articles.description: Karl Darlow was left "annoyed" by Eden Hazard's impudent penalty but the Chelsea star says it was just an instinctive attempt.

articles.description: Germany must not underestimate Mexico, Sweden or South Korea in Group F at the World Cup in Russia, according to Joachim Low.

articles.description: Two goals from Eden Hazard and one from Alvaro Morata saw Chelsea beat Newcastle United 3-1 at Stamford Bridge.

articles.author: FourFourTwo
articles.title: Barcelona 2 Celta Vigo 2: Wasteful hosts drop first points at home in a year
articles.description: Maxi Gomez's equaliser secured Celta Vigo a 2-2 draw at Camp Nou, with Barcelona dropping points at home for the first time in a year.

articles.author: FourFourTwo
articles.title: Giroud – England are afraid of France
articles.description: France are aiming to improve on their last World Cup performance by reaching the semi-finals of Russia 2018, according to Olivier Giroud.

articles.description: Greece defender Kostas Manolas has agreed terms on a three-year extension with Roma, the Serie A club announced on Saturday.

articles.description: James Milner has predicted Manchester City will have "a sticky period" and backed team-mate Mohamed Salah to help Liverpool challenge them.

articles.description: A heroic police officer praised for holding onto a van hanging precariously over a motorway bridge says he was “just doing his job”.

articles.description: The bank emailed 290,000 customers on Saturday following warnings about Russian security software.

articles.description: An argument occurred between the occupants of the vehicle and pedestrians in London.

articles.author: Tim Wigmore
articles.title: The tactics Craig Overton and England's seamers deployed to claim wicket of dangerman Steve Smith
articles.description: An Overton almost played for England in 2013.

articles.author: Jack de Menezes
articles.title: Five things we learned from Chelsea vs Newcastle
articles.description: Chelsea can still challenge City On this showing, the Premier League title battle is more than just a two-horse race. Manchester City remain by far and large the title favourites, but if they slip up, you get the idea that it’ll be Chelsea who are there to try and capitalise.

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.title: Man charged with murder after attempted robbery of Rolex watch
articles.description: Jordan Bailey-Mascoll will appear in court for allegedly stabbing Danny Pearce to death after he refused to hand over watch

articles.author: Chris Stevenson
articles.title: Donald Trump breaks his silence over Michael Flynn charge
articles.description: President Donald Trump has said that there was “absolutely no collusion” between his election campaign and Russia, in his first comments over a guilty plea by his former national security adviser Michael Flynn in connection with the Russia investigation. Mr Flynn pleaded guilty to a charge of lying to the FBI about his contact with Russian officials and had agreed to cooperate with special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into election meddling by Moscow and possible collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign team.

articles.author: Shehab Khan
articles.title: Britain's trade talks with Donald Trump 'a waste of time', warns Nobel Prize-winning economist
articles.description: Beginning trade talks with Donald Trump would be “a waste of time”, a Nobel Prize-winning economist has warned.  Joseph Stiglitz has said the UK should not trust Mr Trump and that Britain should not waste its “scarce resources” attempting to get an agreement.  Speaking to the Today programme on BBC Radio 4, Mr Stiglitz highlighted that the President is looking to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement (Nafta).

articles.author: Jemma Crew
articles.title: Five people hit by car after ‘altercation’ in Brixton
articles.description: Five pedestrians have been taken to hospital after a car collided with a group of people early on Saturday morning, police said. The Metropolitan Police said five men aged between 23 and 42 were injured when a car hit a number of pedestrians on Stockwell Road near the junction of Sidney Road, in south-west London, just before 3am. None of the injured are in a critical condition.

articles.author: Tom Barnes
articles.title: Terrifying waterspout sweeps through town in Italy
articles.description: Remarkable footage has surfaced of a waterspout forming off the Italian coast before tearing through a city. Video shows the vortex being whipped up on Friday near Sanremo, in the north west of the country close to the French border. The huge funnel of water is seen looming over buildings – a phenomenon which lasted for several minutes.

articles.author: Harriet Agerholm
articles.title: Government's chief vet doesn't think all eggs should be free-range
articles.description: The Government's chief veterinary has condemned plans to stop selling eggs from caged hens, saying the proposals were "regrettable" and "simplistic". Nigel Gibbens, who advises the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, said the the commitment by leading retailers to stop selling caged eggs by 2025 was misguided because of the threat posed by bird flu. There was a backlash against the comments from other vets and animal welfare campaigners, who called caged eggs unethical.

articles.author: Lucy Pasha-Robinson
articles.title: Jack Monroe speaks of her 'worst Christmas' living in poverty
articles.description: As a single parent living in poverty, Christmas was the most depressing time of year for Jack Monroe.  “It was a festival of all the things we couldn’t have,” she says. “Adverts on telly show families spending loads of money and you’re just bombarded with it everywhere you go –  this faux festivity and cheer.” The food writer and poverty campaigner found herself in a downward spiral in 2011 after quitting her job due to childcare constraints. She quickly found herself skipping meals to make sure her young son was fed.

articles.author: Sally Hayden
articles.title: Republicans voted to hand tax cuts to America's billionaires in the middle of the night
articles.description: The US Senate has approved a major tax overhaul, bringing the Trump administration one step closer to its aim of slashing taxes for businesses and the wealthy, while delivering mixed changes for the rest of the country. In what would be the largest US tax overhaul since the 1980s, Republicans want to add $1.4 trillion over 10 years to the $20 trillion national debt to finance changes that they say would further boost an already growing economy.

articles.author: Helen Coffey
articles.title: Thomas Cook passengers told they’re ‘lucky to be alive’ by crying cabin crew after plane engine explodes
articles.description: A Thomas Cook flight from Holguin in Cuba to Manchester left passengers scared for their lives after the left engine developed a fault as the plane was taking off. Flight MT2653 was due to depart on Monday 27 November but was grounded following a loud bang and fire seen coming from the engine just as the aircraft’s front wheel left the tarmac.

articles.author: Shehab Khan
articles.title: Shocking footage shows man breaking traffic warden’s shoulder after being given ticket
articles.description: A man broke a traffic warden’s shoulder after noticing he was being given a ticket.  Daniel Corneille, 47, had parked his car on double yellow lines, blocking paving designed to help blind people cross the road.  When he spotted a warden issuing him a ticket on the Isle of Sheppey, he walked over, began shouting and swearing, and aggressively pushed the warden into the window of a shop opposite.

articles.author: Tom Barnes
articles.title: Aldi is handing out all its unsold fresh food to the needy on Christmas Eve
articles.description: Aldi has offered to give all its unsold fresh food away to charities and good causes when its stores close on Christmas Eve.  The supermarket chain issued an appeal on social media urging organisations across the country to collect items left over after its branches have shut up shop for the festive period.

articles.title: Pop singer falls 7ft through trapdoor on stage while performing at concert
articles.description: Beto Cuevas cracked a rib and fractured one of his fingers after falling through a gap when his lost his footing and vanished below the stage while encouraging crowds to clap to the music

articles.description: "That is not who I am today and I’d like to think I’m a little older and wiser"

articles.title: Brandon Flynn Gave Sam Smith The Cutest Shoutout And Our Hearts Can't Cope
articles.description: The 13 Reasons Why star has been getting all cute on Insta.

articles.author: Linds Foley
articles.title: Selena Gomez, Demi Lovato, The Riverdale Cast And More Best Dressed Looks From The 2017 AMAs
articles.description: Also featuring Shawn Mendes looking stylish af.

articles.author: MTV News
articles.title: Looks Like Gemma Collins And Arg Could Be Getting Back Together After All
articles.description: The on again off again romance would appear to be on again. Again.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Chelsea 3-1 Newcastle: Eden Hazard brace helps Blues down Rafael Benitez
articles.description: Eden Hazard struck twice as Chelsea came from behind to beat Newcastle on Rafael Benitez's return to Stamford Bridge and maintain their impressive recent form. Antonio Conte's reigning champions have now won six of their previous seven Premier League games and this 3-1 victory sees them close within eight points of leaders Manchester City. Dwight Gayle came into the Newcastle side in place of the misfiring Joselu and he earned a shock lead for the visitors, who have now taken just one point from their last six games.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Australia just edge England in first day of second Ashes Test
articles.description: England struggled to vindicate Joe Root's gamble to bowl first on a cagey first day of the inaugural pink-ball Ashes Test at the Adelaide Oval. Only Usman Khawaja (53) could post a half-century, and no stand exceeded 53 as England arguably fluffed their lines with the new ball but stuck to their task to restrict Australia to 209 for four at the close. There was a prize maiden wicket for England debutant seamer Craig Overton - home captain Steve Smith - and Chris Woakes edged back towards his best in support of James Anderson and Stuart Broad.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Rugby League World Cup final 2017: England defeated by Australia in Brisbane
articles.description: England fell agonisingly short in their attempt to end a generation's wait for glory as Australia ground out a tense 6-0 victory in the World Cup final. The Kangaroos were forced to defend for their lives in an epic battle of Brisbane before securing their 11th title out of a possible 15, winning the World Cup on home soil for the first time since 1977 in front of a crowd of 40,033 at the Suncorp Stadium.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Revealed: Nathan Redmond explains heated exchange with Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola
articles.description: Southampton star Nathan Redmond has revealed what was said in his heated exchange with Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola. The City boss was criticised for being aggressive and over the top after a video of him scolding Redmond went viral on social media. The clip showed Guardiola in an animated discussion with the Saints forward following City’s late 2-1 victory over Southampton on Wednesday.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Mayor of London takes control of West Ham's London Stadium following 'catalogue of errors' over finances
articles.description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan has agreed to take control of the London Stadium and will renegotiate deals following an independent review that exposed ‘a catalogue of errors’ made by Boris Johnson. The review was published on Friday morning, and it said that the deals and decision made by the former Mayor of London and his administration led to massively increased costs over conversion after the London 2012 Olympics.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: Chelsea manager Antonio Conte accepts FA misconduct charge after confronting referee
articles.description: Chelsea head coach Antonio Conte intends to accept a Football Association charge of misconduct following his dismissal against Swansea on Wednesday. The Italian was sent to the stands by referee Neil Swarbrick towards the end of the first half of Chelsea's 1-0 victory after furiously protesting the award of a Swansea goal-kick.

articles.author: talkSPORT
articles.title: World Cup 2018: England to face Belgium, Tunisia and Panama - draw in full
articles.description: England were handed a favourable draw for the 2018 World Cup in Russia after being chosen to face Belgium, Panama and Tunisia in Group G. After avoiding Argentina, Brazil and Germany, England were the penultimate team picked from Pot 2 by Diego Maradona in the draw ceremony in the Kremlin's State Palace. Gareth Southgate's side will face Tunisia in their opening game in Volgograd on June 18, a repeat of their first game in the 1998 World Cup in France, when goals from Alan Shearer and Paul Scholes gave England a 2-0 win in Marseille.
